item.description: Organizers Juan D. Pinto is a PhD student at the University of Illinois Urbana‐Champaign. His research involves the development of learner models using machine learning methods and tackling issues of AI interpretability in education. He is currently conducting work as a member of the Human‐centered Educational Data Science (HEDS) Lab and the NSF AI Institute for Inclusive Intelligent Technologies for Education (INVITE). Luc Paquette is an associate professor in the department of curriculum & instruction at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

Schedule The following proposed schedule is tentative and may be adjusted based on the number of submissions and the availability of invited speakers. 9:00–9:30am Welcome and opening remarks 9:30–10:30am Invited keynote talk 10:30–10:45am Break 10:45am–12:00pm Poster session 12:00–1:00pm Lunch 1:00–1:45pm Panel debate 1:45–2:30pm Working session 1: Framing problems and needs 2:30–2:45pm Break 2:45–3:15pm Working session 2: Breakout group brainstorming 3:15–4:30pm Working session 3: Creating a shared vision 4:30–4:45pm Closing thoughts
